Detailed Description

Header file for IP.c.

Define Documentation

#define BROADCAST_IP_ADDRESS   {0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF}

Protocol IP address of the broadcast address

#define CLIENT_IP_ADDRESS   { 10, 0, 0, 1}

Protocol IP address of the host (client) machine, once assigned by DHCP

#define DEFAULT_TTL   128

Default Time To Live (TTL) value for sent packets, indicating the maximum allowable hops until their destination is reached

#define IP_COMPARE ( IP1,
IP2   )     (memcmp(IP1, IP2, sizeof(IP_Address_t)) == 0)

Performs a comparison between two IP addresses, indicating if they are identical.

Parameters:
[in] IP1 First IP address
[in] IP2 Second IP address
Returns:
True if the addresses match, false otherwise
#define SERVER_IP_ADDRESS   { 10, 0, 0, 2}

Protocol IP address of the virtual server machine

Function Documentation

int16_t IP_ProcessIPPacket ( Ethernet_Frame_Info_t *  FrameIN,
void *  InDataStart,
void *  OutDataStart 
)

Processes an IP packet inside an Ethernet frame, and writes the appropriate response to the output Ethernet frame if one is created by a sub-protocol handler.

Parameters:
[in] FrameIN Pointer to the incoming Ethernet frame information structure
[in] InDataStart Pointer to the start of the incoming packet's IP header
[out] OutDataStart Pointer to the start of the outgoing packet's IP header
Returns:
The number of bytes written to the out Ethernet frame if any, NO_RESPONSE if no response was generated, NO_PROCESS if the packet processing was deferred until the next Ethernet packet handler iteration
